item.title: T1 Sales Support Services
item.description:
If you’re interested in earning money by selling business voice and data services, there’s a brokerage service that can simplify the process. The VAR Network, managed by Telarus, Inc., connects telecom providers with VARs (Value Added Resellers). VARs typically represent manufacturers of business phone systems, network equipment, video conferencing tools, and similar products. They often handle both sales and service, providing clients with complete solutions and ongoing support. Many VARs, focused on hardware and software, haven’t ventured into selling telephone lines or WAN services, which are crucial for a comprehensive business solution...

item.title: Use a Telecom Broker Before You Go Broker
item.description:
Are you getting the best deal on your telecom services? It’s hard to know when every provider claims to offer the best rates. Comparing plans and prices from multiple companies is time-consuming and challenging. That’s where telecom brokers come in. Telecom brokers are independent experts who work on your behalf to find the best telecom deals. They are not affiliated with any specific provider, ensuring unbiased recommendations. Similar to independent insurance agents, telecom brokers represent multiple carriers, giving you access to a wide range of options...

item.title: How SD-WAN Hands-Off Seamlessly
item.description:
By: John Shepler It would be ideal if WAN network connections never failed, but unfortunately, that’s not the case. Even the most reliable copper, fiber, or wireless connections eventually experience downtime. This can interrupt phone calls, halt ongoing work, and lead to lost productivity and revenue. However, imagine a solution that ensures your connections remain virtually uninterrupted, experiencing only minor, momentary glitches regardless of the underlying issue. This solution exists and is called SD-WAN, or Software-Defined Wide Area Networking...
